of pET15b-6HisSUMO-Rab12 plasmid (around
) with
-
of the competent BL21(DE3) cells and incubate
for

source.description:
Transfer the vial to a heat block equilibrated at
and leave for
.

source.title: Transformation of plasmid into competent bacteria

source.description:
Transfer the vial back into ice and add
SOC medium and mix gently.

source.title: Transformation of plasmid into competent bacteria

source.description:
Incubate for
at
for recovery.

source.title: Transformation of plasmid into competent bacteria

source.description:
Plate
of the transformation onto a LB broth/agar plate supplemented with
carbenicillin.

source.title: Transformation of plasmid into competent bacteria

source.description:
Leave the plate
in a
incubator.

source.title: Overnight culture

source.description:
Using a
pipette tip, remove one of the colonies from the plate and drop the tip into
LB broth medium, supplemented with
carbenicillin.

source.title: Overnight culture

source.description:
Incubate at
with
-
rotational shaking
.

source.body: The culture medium should become totally opaque in the morning.

source.title: Set up cells and induce expression

source.description:
Decant 6 x
LB broth medium into 6 x
conical flasks.

source.title: Set up cells and induce expression

source.description:
Supplement each flask/litre with
of
Carbenicillin.

source.title: Set up cells and induce expression

source.description:
Mix and add
–
of the
culture into each flask.

source.title: Set up cells and induce expression

source.description:
Incubate for around
at
, using an Infors Shaker-Incubator set at
.

source.title: Set up cells and induce expression

source.description:
Sample two or three of the expressions by removing
medium and comparing the optical density at
with fresh LB medium, using a WPA cell densitometer or a spectrometer.

source.title: Set up cells and induce expression

source.description:
When the OD600 has reached 0.7-0.9, change the temperature setting of the Infors incubator to
and incubate the cells for at least another hour, all the while shaking at
.

source.title: Set up cells and induce expression

source.description:
When the flasks have cooled down to
or lower, induce His-SUMO-Rab12 expression by supplementing the medium with
IPTG.

source.body: This is achieved by adding of a IPTG stock solution to each litre.

source.title: Set up cells and induce expression

source.description:
Leave the cells to express the protein for
at
.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
The following morning prepare
of cell collection buffer and chill
.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Decant the content of the
conical flasks into
Beckman centrifuge pots, close the pots with their screwcap lids and sediment the cells by centrifugation for
at
at
using a Beckman J6 centrifuge with the 6 x 1 L rotor (4.2).

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description: Collect and open the pots and carefully, decant the spent supernatant medium back into the flasks.

source.body: The flasks can now be sent for cleaning and autoclaving. The cell sediment in the pots is expected to have a volume of – .

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Add
of cold cell collection buffer to the sediment.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Transfer the
pots to the Infors incubator and set the temperature to
and the rotation to
.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Leave the pots for
, after which time the cell sediment should have completely resuspended.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Pool all suspensions into one of the 6 pots using a
pipette and a good pipettor. If any of the sediments has not well resuspended, pipette up and down close to the bottom of the pots.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
For Rab proteins, supplement the NaCl concentration to
and add glycerol to 5% (by vol) final concentration.

source.body: It is important to add the NaCl and glycerol after the resuspension step and not before as this interferes with the resuspension.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Once the NaCl and glycerol has been mixed in, aliquot
samples into
centrifuge vials and freeze them in liquid nitrogen for at least
.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Store the vials at
for up to
. The freezing and subsequent thawing step breaks up the cells and improves yield.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description: Slowly thaw the vials with the cell suspension in cold water.

source.body: We have verified that it is OK to leave the tubes to thaw samples by leaving these at .

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
After thawing chill suspension
and then sonicate, using a probe sonicator (Cell disruptor).

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Settings: 6 – 8 pulses of
with
pauses. Set the amplitude to 50%.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
The lysate will warm up slightly, but make sure it does not warm up over
and keep samples cool by swirling
.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Transfer the sonicated suspension into
Beckman centrifuge vials and sediment the insoluble material by centrifugation for
at
an
using a 25.50 or a 30.50 rotor in a Beckman Avanti centrifuge.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Recover the supernatant by carefully decanting it into a
Corning PP conical centrifuge tube.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
During the centrifugation step, equilibrate
Ni-agarose (
of a 50% slurry, sufficient for a 6 L expression) by washing it three times with Milli Q water and once with cell collection buffer.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Add a 50% slurry of the washed Ni-agarose in collection buffer to the lysate and incubate the mix on a Roller Mixer for
in a cold room set at
.

source.body: Avoid excessive agitation and especially formation of foam.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description: In the meanwhile, prepare Ni-wash buffer.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Carefully sediment the Ni-agarose by centrifugation using a Beckman J6 with a 4.2 rotor and suitable adaptors. Centrifuge at
for
at
.

source.body: Avoid higher centrifugation speeds as the PP conical centrifuge vessels are structurally weak.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Remove the lid and carefully decant the supernatant containing the depleted lysate using a
pipette, being careful not to disturb the Ni-agarose.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Add
of Ni-wash buffer.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Prepare a
pipette tip by removing
–
from the pointed end using scissors. This allows it to be used to facilely resuspend the agarose.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Resuspend the Ni-agarose using a P1000 with such a modified blue tip and aliquot the Ni-agarose into a
centrifuge vial.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Wash out any remaining agarose from the large vial with
of Ni-wash buffer and pool with the first batch to maximise recovery.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Fill the
vial to the top with Ni-wash buffer, mix well and sediment resin by centrifugation at
for
using an Eppendorf 5810 R centrifuge.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description: Remove the Ni-wash buffer with a thin vacuum line and replace with fresh Ni-wash buffer. Repeat this step 5 times in total to thoroughly wash the resin.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description: Remove all Ni-wash buffer without disturbing the agarose bed.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Resuspend the Ni-agarose into
wash buffer, transfer into a BIORAD Econopac column and let the buffer run out.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Add
of Ni-elution buffer and let the void of the bed run out.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-Rab12 on Ni-agarose

source.description:
Then elute the protein with
Ni-elution buffer into a
centrifuge vial.

source.body: This should provide of protein solution of - ( – total protein).

source.title: Polishing and buffer exchange by SEC

source.description:
In order to improve protein purity and to remove the imidazole prepare a Superdex 75 XK16/60 column by equilibration into SEC buffer
.

source.title: Polishing and buffer exchange by SEC

source.description:
Apply
of the His-SUMO-Rab12 and perform chromatography on that column. The His-SUMO-RAB12 elutes at
(Figure 1). Pool the peak fractions.

source.title: Removal of His-SUMO-tag and phosphorylation by MST3

source.description: Proceed by taking two aliquots, one to be left unphosphorylated and another to be phosphorylated.

source.title: Removal of His-SUMO-tag and phosphorylation by MST3

source.description:
To remove the tag, add His-SENP1 protease to the His-SUMO-Rab12 aliquots at a ratio of
of protease per
of substrate.

source.title: Removal of His-SUMO-tag and phosphorylation by MST3

source.description:
To the aliquot to be phosphorylated also add
of His-MST3 kinase and make the solution
MgCl2 and
ATP (
).

source.title: Removal of His-SUMO-tag and phosphorylation by MST3

source.description:
Incubate at
.

source.title: Removal of His-SUMO-tag and phosphorylation by MST3

source.description:
Prepare two Biorad
Polyprep filters with
Ni-agarose beds, equilibrate in wash buffer.

source.title: Removal of His-SUMO-tag and phosphorylation by MST3

source.description: Individually pass the proteins through these filters, in order to remove the His-tagged enzymes and the cleaved His-SUMO-tag.

source.title: Removal of His-SUMO-tag and phosphorylation by MST3

source.description: For further purification and removal of ATP, equilibrate a Superdex 75 HR10/30 column into SEC buffer

source.title: Removal of His-SUMO-tag and phosphorylation by MST3

source.description: Apply the Rab12 samples and collect fractions.

source.body: The cleaved Rab12 protein elutes at - peaking at (Figure 2).

source.title: Chromatography on a Source 15 S HR10/10 column to separate phospho  species

source.description: In order to separate the phospho species from each other and from the remaining unphosphorylated protein, employ cation exchange chromatography using a Source 15 S column.

source.title: Chromatography on a Source 15 S HR10/10 column to separate phospho  species

source.description:
To this end, pack an empty HR10/10 or GL 10/100 column with
Source 15 S resin and use vacuum suction to obtain a homogenous well packed resin bed.

source.body: Ion exchange chromatography is a concentrating method, hence the load volume is not critical.

source.title: Chromatography on a Source 15 S HR10/10 column to separate phospho  species

source.description: Dilute the aliquots of the Rab12 samples into the Low Salt buffer to reduce the ionic strength sufficiently for the protein to bind.

source.title: Chromatography on a Source 15 S HR10/10 column to separate phospho  species

source.description: Equilibrate the Source 15 S HR10/10 with the IEX- buffers using an Akta Pure or Purifier.

source.title: Chromatography on a Source 15 S HR10/10 column to separate phospho  species

source.description: Dilute the Rab12 protein isolated from the gel filtration step tenfold into the IEX-LowSalt buffer.

source.title: Chromatography on a Source 15 S HR10/10 column to separate phospho  species

source.description:
Apply aliquots equivalent up to
to the S-column at a flowrate of
.

source.title: Chromatography on a Source 15 S HR10/10 column to separate phospho  species

source.description:
Develop the column at the same flow rate with a shallow
gradient to 30% IEX-High Salt buffer collecting
fractions.

source.body: pRab12 eluted as a major peak with a conductivity of 15 mS/cm, equivalent to NaCl ( Figure 3). Our QC analysis indicates that the major peak is mono phosphorylated Rab12. The minor peak to the left is double phosphorylated Rab12.

source.title: Quality control

source.description:
Separate
of the protein on a 4% - 20% Tris Glycine SDS polyacrylamid gel and stain with Instant Blue (Figure 4a).

source.body: The protein should be >95% homogeneous.

source.title: Quality control

source.description:
Separate
of pRab12 and
of phosphorylated Rab12, which had been treated with alkalyne phosphatase on a 12% Phos-tag SDS-Polyacrylamid gel that separates phosphorylated and non-phosphorylated Rab proteins, run as described previously (Ito et al. 2016) (Figure 4b).

source.body: The migration of the phosphorylated and non-phosphorylated pRab12 proteins can clearly be distinguished.

source.title: Quality control

source.description:
Do Immunoblot analysis of pRab12 and dephosphorylated Rab12 using Rab12 pSer106 and total antibodies (Figure 5). This will reveal that the pRab12 protein is specifically phosphorylated at Ser106.
Figure 5. Indicated amounts of pRab12 (P) and dephosphorylated Rab12 (NP) were analysed using Phostag SDS-PAGE (Coomassie stained as well as immunoblotted with Rab12 total/pS106 antibodies), and SDS-PAGE (immunoblotted with Rab12 total/pS106 antibodies).

description: A subset of small GTPases of the Rab family including Rab12 (Uniprot: Q6IQ22) have been identified as substrates of the Leucine Rich Repeat Kinase 2 (LRRK2; Uniprot Q5S007) (Steger et al., 2016). In order to perform detailed study of Rab phosphorylation and dephosphorylation, as well as produce phosphorylation site-specific antibodies, and to carry out drug discovery screens, it is necessary to produce hundreds of milligrams of pure, stoichiometrically phosphorylated Rab12 protein. The full-length sequence of Rab12 (1-244) is suitable for large scale expression, when expressed as a 6His-SUMO fusion protein. Here we describe in detail the method we use to produce milligram quantities of stoichiometrically Ser106 phosphorylated Rab12 with the 6His-SUMO tag removed employing the SENP1 protease. We employ the MST3 kinase to phosphorylate Rab12 at Ser106, as this kinase is much easier and less expensive to produce or purchase than LRRK2 (Berndsen et al., 2019, Vieweg et al. 2020).
